trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract base class for all options objects.
Returns a copy of the object.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
The cloned object.
Gets or sets a WMI context object.
This is a name-value pairs list to be passed through to a WMI provider that supports context information for customized operation.
Property Value
A name-value pairs list to be passed through to a WMI provider that supports context information for customized operation.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.Management.ManagementNamedValueCollection"></xref> that contains WMI context information.
Indicates that no timeout should occur.
This value is used with the <xref:System.Management.ManagementOptions.Timeout%2A> property.
Gets or sets the time-out to apply to the operation.

Note that for operations that return collections, this time-out applies to the enumeration through the resulting collection, not the operation itself (the <xref href="System.Management.EnumerationOptions.ReturnImmediately"></xref> property is used for the latter).
This property is used to indicate that the operation should be performed semi-synchronously.

The <xref:System.Management.ManagementOptions.Timeout%2A> property is used in the corresponding semi-synchronous operation for the following classes: <xref:System.Management.ObjectGetOptions>, <xref:System.Management.PutOptions>, <xref:System.Management.DeleteOptions>, <xref:System.Management.InvokeMethodOptions>, <xref:System.Management.EnumerationOptions>, and <xref:System.Management.EventWatcherOptions>.
This property has no effect on the <xref:System.Management.ManagementScope.Connect> method.
Property Value
The default value for this property is <xref:System.TimeSpan.MaxValue>, which means the operation will block.
The value specified must be positive.
.NET Framework Security
Full trust for the immediate caller.
This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.
For more information, see [Using Libraries from Partially Trusted Code](~/docs/framework/misc/using-libraries-from-partially-trusted-code.md).
Returns a <xref href="System.TimeSpan"></xref> that defines the time-out time to apply to the operation.
